textBeforeTable: Opossums Family Didelphidae    Subfamily Caluromyinae ORDER DIDELPHIMORPHA   Quelch, J. J. 1901. Animal life in British Guiana. The Argosy Company, Limited, Georgetown, Guyana. Bertram, C. 1963. In Search of Mermaids: The Manatees of Guiana. Peter Davies Ltd., London, 183 pp. USNM - Department of Vertebrate Zoology, National Museum of Natural History, Smithsonian Institution, Washington DC. ROM - Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. BMNH - British Museum (Natural History), London. AMNH - American Museum of Natural History, New York. Musuems holding voucher specimens and publications cited are abbreviated as follows: Vernacular names follow: Emmons, Louise H. and François Feer. 1997. Neotropical Rainforest Mammals: A Field Guide. Second edition. University of Chicago Press. Indications are given in the final column if close monitoring of a species is needed, as presented in: Engstrom, M.D., and B.K. Lim. 2001. Mamíferos de Guyana. In: Ceballos, G., and J.A. Simonetti (eds.). Diversidad y conservación de los mamíferos de Latinoamérica. Fondo de Cultura Económica-UNAM. México, D.F. In press. Conservation information includes CITES Appendix listings and IUCN Red List of Threatened Animals categories. CITES Appendix I lists species that are threatened with extinction. Trade in specimens of these species is permitted only in exceptional circumstances. CITES Appendix II lists species that are not necessarily threatened with extinction, but in which trade must be controlled in order to avoid utilization incompatible with their survival.
